titleStmt.title: George E. Johnston et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9702

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To the Hon Beriah Magoffin Governer of Kentucky The undersigned pettioners would respectfully represent unto your honor that at the September Term of the Taylor Circuit Court a fine of $200 -- was assessed against James Jones on a presentment for gaming the undersigned would most respectfully represent unto your honor that said Jones is quite a poor man with a family & that it will take all his property to pay said fine We would further represent that he took the case to the court of Appeals but for want of the clerk in the Court below getting the second ready in time the case was dismissed in the court of appeals a copy of the instructions in the court below -- the bill of exceptions the affidavit for a new trial & the case are all made a part of this petition & in view of the premiseswhole premises we most respectfully petition your Hon to remit said fine as it will seriously injure said Jones & his family as it will take their entire means to pay said fine Dec 12th 1860

Geo. E. Johnston
George M Johnston
Jonas B Allen
B F F Chelf
B. F. Smith
A, Haselwood
Croml Hoskins
W L Hoskins
Wesley Richeson
J P Campbell
Alex Wilson
W. F. Warren
Wm. P. Warren
